p: Valuable anticancer alkaloid homoharringtonine (HHT) for the first time has been isolated from the bark and leaves of threatened medicinal tree Cephalotaxus harringtonia [ 89]. It acts as a translation inhibitor during G 1 and G 2 phases of cell division. In 2012, homoharringtonine was approved for the treatment of chronic myeloid leukemia under generic name omacetaxine mepeosuccinate by the Food and Drug Administration of the USA [ 90]. Hu et al. in 2016 screened 213 fungal strains isolated from the bark of Cephalotaxus hainanensis for the HHT biosynthesis ability and found that Alternaria tenuissima was a stable HHT-producing endophyte [ 45].
